abstract: Newark Mayor Ras J Baraka has defied expectations of being anti-business and anti-police in his first year in office, winning praise from leaders of city's business community and government, who are largely white; Baraka's supporters say his pragmatism has distinguished him as mayor for all city's residents, although critics say much of praise is due to low expectations.
lead_paragraph: The mayor, who took office last summer, is gaining attention for his efforts to curb crime and spur economic development.

headline.main: Defying Expectations, Mayor Ras Baraka Is Praised in All Corners of Newark
headline.print_headline: Defying Expectations in Newark, Mayor Is Praised in All Corners

snippet: The mayor, who took office last summer, is gaining attention for his efforts to curb crime and spur economic development.
